explainability.findings: Sources describe documented explainability practices in 1 source(s). Additional documentation references related practices.
explainability.path_to_improvement: Publish user-facing explanation interfaces or documented appeal workflows.

relevant_sources.summary: This privacy policy document provides evidence for the **privacy**, **governance**, and **oversight** pillars of responsible AI. It supports the privacy pillar by detailing data collection and use for profiling and targeted advertising, and by outlining consumer choices regarding data sharing. The document demonstrates governance by mentioning data handling policies for AI use, vendor requirements, and auditing compliance for automated systems. Furthermore, it supports oversight by granting individuals rights to review automated decisions, opt-out of targeted advertising, and complain about AI processing.
relevant_sources.title: Global Privacy Policy – Scopes and Updates

external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Obtain external validation of AI practices or require vendor certifications.

fairness.path_to_improvement: Document bias testing procedures or vendor AI fairness requirements.

governance.findings: Kimberly-Clark's policy documents mention data handling policies for AI use, vendor requirements, and auditing compliance for automated systems. Documentation also references custom AI models, AI agents integrated into teams, and AI deployment as part of IT initiatives, alongside partnerships with IT for safe tool use. Furthermore, an integrated platform for cross-functional planning, a control tower for AI insights, and structured processes for chatbots and notifications are described.
governance.path_to_improvement: Name an AI governance body with defined mandate covering all AI use.

relevant_sources.summary: This privacy policy document provides evidence for the **privacy**, **governance**, and **oversight** pillars of responsible AI. It supports the privacy pillar by detailing data collection and use for profiling and targeted advertising, and by outlining consumer choices regarding data sharing. Furthermore, it supports oversight by granting individuals rights to review automated decisions, opt-out of targeted advertising, and complain about AI processing.
relevant_sources.title: Global Privacy Policy – Scopes and Updates

relevant_sources.summary: This CIO.com blog post on Kimberly-Clark's digital transformation provides evidence for **governance** and **transparency**. The article highlights the company's use of AI and ML for various applications, such as fraud detection and improving processing accuracy, which supports transparency by indicating the application of AI. Furthermore, the mention of custom AI models, AI agents integrated into teams, and the deployment of AI as part of IT initiatives suggests a framework for managing and overseeing these AI deployments, thereby supporting governance.
relevant_sources.title: Kimberly-Clark's business-first approach to digital transformation

relevant_sources.summary: This blog post provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. It supports governance by mentioning partnerships with IT to ensure safe and correct tool use, implying oversight in technology adoption. Transparency is demonstrated through the article's description of AI's role in democratizing data and providing equal access to insights, as well as detailing AI use cases for optimizing content and search results through pilot programs and prompt refinement.
relevant_sources.title: How Bic, Kimberly-Clark Use AI to Democratize Data, Reshape Sales, Marketing Teamwork

relevant_sources.summary: This third-party blog post, "AI in Supply Chain and Logistics," provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. The post highlights Kimberly-Clark's use of AI and machine learning for monitoring, estimating, and optimizing supply chains, which demonstrates transparency in their AI applications. Furthermore, the mention of an integrated platform for cross-functional planning and a control tower for AI insights indicates mechanisms for governance over AI decision-making and recommendations.
relevant_sources.title: AI in Supply Chain and Logistics

relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned help page, "Purchase Orders - Procuree Chatbot Portal," provides evidence for the **governance** pillar of responsible AI. The page describes a chatbot used for purchase order exception handling and supplier assistance, indicating structured, automated processes. The mention of a structured notification process further supports its relevance to governance.
relevant_sources.title: Purchase Orders - Procuree Chatbot Portal

relevant_sources.summary: This press release provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. It highlights the collaborative development of a Generative AI chatbot, demonstrating a governance approach to its creation. Furthermore, the mention of the chatbot's deployment supports transparency by detailing a specific AI application being utilized.
relevant_sources.title: India's Thriving Tech Hub Fuels Kimberly-Clark's Digital Transformation

oversight.findings: Policy documents grant individuals rights to review automated decisions and to opt-out of targeted advertising. Individuals also have the right to complain about AI processing, as outlined in these documents.
oversight.path_to_improvement: Publish override mechanisms, escalation processes, or appeal workflows.

privacy.findings: Policy documents detail the practices for data collection and its use in profiling and targeted advertising. These documents also outline consumer choices concerning data sharing.
privacy.path_to_improvement: Publish AI-specific privacy impact assessments or data handling procedures.

transparency.findings: Kimberly-Clark's documentation describes the use and capabilities of various AI tools and platforms, such as Violet, Dora, POBA, and LevelLoad, across manufacturing, R&D, customer prediction, and supply chain optimization. These descriptions detail AI applications for demand forecasting, transportation planning, fraud detection, processing accuracy, data democratization, and content optimization, including the deployment of a Generative AI chatbot.
transparency.path_to_improvement: Publish detailed documentation (model cards, system specs) for AI systems deployed.

relevant_sources.summary: This blog post provides evidence for the **transparency** pillar of responsible AI. It describes the use of AI tools like Violet, Dora, and POBA, showcasing their capabilities in manufacturing, R&D, and customer prediction, which implicitly demonstrates transparency in the AI's intended applications and potential benefits. The mention of AI enabling robust applications further suggests a level of transparency regarding the technology's functional scope.
relevant_sources.title: How Kimberly-Clark's Zack Hicks heeds the call for innovation

relevant_sources.summary: This blog post provides evidence for the **transparency** pillar of responsible AI. It discusses the capabilities of Kimberly-Clark's AI platform, including its use of machine learning for demand forecasting and optimization algorithms for transportation capacity planning. While the post highlights the AI's impact and continuous execution in routing orders, it lacks specific operational or policy details regarding the AI's internal workings or decision-making processes.
relevant_sources.title: Kimberly-Clark: AI-enabled transportation transformation

relevant_sources.summary: This blog post, "Kimberly-Clark's Supply Chain Optimization," provides evidence for the **transparency** pillar of responsible AI. The documentation describes the use of AI-driven technology, machine learning, and optimization algorithms within Kimberly-Clark's LevelLoad platform. While it details the capabilities of these systems, such as real-time visibility and transportation planning, it focuses on the technical aspects rather than specific policies or operational execution.
relevant_sources.title: Kimberly-Clark's Supply Chain Optimization

summary.overall_findings: Kimberly-Clark's published materials describe the use of AI tools such as Violet, Dora, and POBA, detailing their capabilities in manufacturing, R&D, and customer prediction. These disclosures, which address 5 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars, also outline policy-level practices including individuals' rights to review automated decisions under oversight and data handling policies for AI use, vendor requirements, and auditing compliance for automated systems under governance. Furthermore, policy documents detail data collection and use for profiling and targeted advertising within privacy, and describe documented explainability practices. Based on a review of 10 publicly available sources, no qualifying public evidence was found for fairness or external accountability.
